name: Premier Inn Sheffield - Meadowhall

reviews.text: The title meant the hotel not me. Forget Lenny Henry's advert when you stay at this hotel. I am sure 10 years ago when it was last decorated it was very nice, looking like Lenny's advert, but not now. Me and my son booked here for 3 nights last week for the European karate competition in which my son was competing. I booked a room for 2 people expecting twin beds but we had a rock hard mattress on a double bed and a camp bed situated next to it. Ok I thought, we will make do.
reviews.title: Tired!

reviews.text: Everywhere in the hotel is drab, needs painting, new carpets etc. Doing my "Hotel Inspector" impersonation I ran my finger over the top of the leatherette screwed to the wall headboard of the double bed and found 10mm of dust and another 10mm on the "tasteful" print on the opposite wall. Again the bathroom very dated, drab, with the plastic shower curtain and scuffed wooden skirting boards, yet worse still, the thinnest, cheapest toilet paper they can buy!
reviews.title: A very good place

reviews.text: On arrival, forgot to mention, very important to those thinking of staying here, I was asked if we are dining here, which I replied yes, and was told I must book otherwise we will be turned away.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant

reviews.text: Same goes for breakfast. I asked if residents have preference for the restaurant and was told that she meant the residents and once they have taken enough bookings for the number of staff they have then that's it for the day, you cannot eat!
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: Back that evening for dinner and was seated by a very helpful polite young man who brought the menus and took drink orders. Even though tables were empty people who did not book were turned away, residents or not! The 2 servers were very polite, helpful and charming, and were running about, struggling to keep everyone happy as I'm sure the cook was, only 1 I bet.
reviews.title: Just as needed for work

reviews.text: Just spent evening at this hotel with friends, only stayed one night as a break from driving, excellent value with very friendly staff, room was clean,spacious and comfortable. Will certainly stay again.
reviews.title: excellent value and service

reviews.text: After a fabulous stay at the PI Albert Dock, Liverpool, the previous night, Meadowhall was a disaster. Hotel is fine, if very noisy. But the restaurant is a disaster area. The food was ok, but staffing levels, speed and efficiency defy any logical thinking at all. 20 odd tables served by 2 staff, one of which was working her 5th night, and needed some serious training. Several tables got completely the wrong order, one guy didn't get his meal at all, and my three courses took over 2 hours! And I had to chase the waitress across the room just so I could get my order taken, as she just kept ignoring me. Unbelievable!! Stay at the hotel if its convenient, but eat at TGI Fridays next door.
reviews.title: From the sublime to the down- right awful.

reviews.text: I stayed at this Premier Inn for 8wks with work, and it truly was a joy. The room I had was spacious and very comfortable - my bed in particular was large and very comfy!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel, friendly staff, tremendous value

reviews.text: Staying for so long I was worried that I would get a bit sick of the hotel, but the staff were all an absolute pleasure to deal with! Very helpful, chatty and very professional. There are two ladies who do the breakfast in a morning who were particularly lovely and very professional!!
reviews.title: Just Average

reviews.text: I cannot praise this hotel enough, as the room and service were much better than I have experienced in hotels which charge 2 or 3 times what I paid here. Perfect location for Meadowhall, the Arena and a short team ride away from the city centre.
reviews.title: Excellent stay
Another good Premier Inn...attached restaurant FAB
reviews.text: Stayed here one night at the weekend and would certainly recommend to others and happily stay again. Staff helpful and courteous, ample free parking, comfy clean rooms and attached restaurant was excellent both at dinner and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay in this premier inn. The room was comfy and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant served lovely food, the apple crumble was to die for! The service was extremely efficient. Great location opposite the meadow hall shopping centre. Would definitely stay again
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I stayed a night in this hotel in order to break a long journey.
reviews.title: A good night's sleep

reviews.text: Checkin after 11pm was quick and easy.
reviews.title: As always...a nice, comfortable, trouble free stay!

reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable, and I couldn't hear the traffic from the nearby busy road.
reviews.title: Choose another Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on 25th Oct and had a family room.We found the hotel to be very clean, comfortable and warm.As a regular travelodge customer I can say we were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel and would definitely choose Premier Inn over Travelodge any day.We stayed for breakfast the next morning and were amazed at the selection on offer and the quality of the food. It ws delicious and very good value for money!!!.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: Also the staff were extremely professional,friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable
reviews.title: Probably a 3.5 really...

reviews.text: Thank you
reviews.title: Friendliest Staff Ever in a Motel

reviews.text: ....but a couple of points let it down.
reviews.title: Kind and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, we were given our key for our room after checking inn and when we went there, walked in to an occupied room. That was a near miss and could have been very embarrassing!! Staff helpful to rectify and assist with other needs.
reviews.title: Reasonable value and good location, not that tired.

description: Sheffield Meadowhall Premier Inn has everything you'd expect, incredibly comfy beds in every room and an integrated restaurant serving a mix of traditional and contemporary dishes. Ideally located within easy reach of the M1, opposite Meadowhall shopping centre. Local attractions include Ice Sheffield, Motorpoint Arena, The Institute of sport and Valley Centertainment. Conveniently positioned for Meadowhall train station and just 3 miles from Sheffield train station.
